intro: Draba fladnizensis f. lapponica, commonly known as the Lapland draba, is a rare and low-growing plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. This subspecies is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in alpine and arctic regions. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often seen in tundra and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
